arm_group.arm_group_label: Spinal Anesthesia with cerebral oxygen saturation monitoring
arm_group.description: The cerebral oxygen saturation of the right and left frontal lobe as well as the thigh oxygen saturation are monitored during spinal anesthesia by means of the near-infrared spectroscopy. Hemodynamic variables were recorded at the same time points.

brief_summary.textblock:
The cerebral oxygen saturation is assessed by means of near-infrared spectometry in
      parturients undergoing cesarean delivery under spinal anesthesia. The investigators
      hypothesis was that spinal anesthesia does not influence cerebral oxygen saturation.

clinical_study.brief_title: Spinal Anesthesia for Cesarean Delivery is Associated With Decreases in Regional Cerebral Oxygen Saturation as Assessed by Near- Infrared Spectroscopy
clinical_study.condition: Cerebral Oxygen Saturation During Spinal Anesthesia for Cesarean Delivery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Term healthy parturients

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Body Mass Index > 35

          -  preeclampsia

          -  neurological,cardiovascular, respiratory disease

intervention.arm_group_label: Spinal Anesthesia with cerebral oxygen saturation monitoring
intervention.intervention_name: Spinal Anesthesia with cerebral oxygen saturation monitoring
intervention.other_name: INVOS (cerebral oximeter model 5100, Somanetics, Troy, MI, USA)

other_outcome.description: Hemodynamic changes (changes in Blood Pressure and Heart rate) may reflect blood redistribution due to spinal block
other_outcome.measure: Hemodynamic changes (Changes in Blood Pressure (mmHg) and Heart rate (beats/min)
other_outcome.time_frame: 5, 10, 50 min after spinal, 1 minute after delivery

primary_outcome.description: Cerebral oxygen saturation is important as it may affect patient's outcome
primary_outcome.measure: cerebral oxygen saturation of the right frontal lobe
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from the performing of spinal anesthesia untill  1 minute after delivery

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Cerebral oxygen saturation is important for patient's outcome
secondary_outcome.measure: cerebral oxygen saturation of the left frontal lobe
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5, 10, 50 min after spinal,1 minute after delivery

secondary_outcome.description: Thigh oxygen saturation may reflect blood redistribution due to spinal block
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5, 10, 50 min after spinal, 1 minute after delivery

secondary_outcome.description: Changes in arterial oxygenation may reflect blood redistribution due to spinal block
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5, 10, 50 min after spinal, 1 minute after delivery

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
